. It's a city tough the overwhelming majority of it is residential. Nearly all the businesses are in the downtown, so unless you plan on visiting some of the houses, it's a town for piratical purposes.
There is no direct public transportation to Great Falls. However, it can be reached via a $20-$25 taxi ride from the Dunn Loring or West Falls Church metro stations on the Orange Line of the
In Great Falls Park, there are several viewing platforms that provide vantage points overlooking the falls.
Popular activities in the parks include hiking, boating, fishing, picnicking, disc golf, and hunting.

value: content=Great regional park, hailed as Northern Virginia's backyard and very popular for picnics and barbecues. Common activities include hiking, rock climbing, and whitewater rafting. There can be lines into the park on weekends, especially on holidays like Fathers' Day and Labor Day, so plan ahead. The park has several marked trails, including the very popular Billy Goat Trail
address=8700 Potomac Hills St, Great Falls, VA 22066
directions=From Great Falls Park entrance road, turn right on Georgetown Pike, right on River Bend Road, right on Jeffery Road, and right at the park entrance

content=Did you get turned away from Great Falls Park on an overcrowded weekend, and need an alternative location for your Fathers' Day barbecue? Head straight to Riverbend Park, Great Falls' best-kept secret, just up the river. Picnics, barbecues, hiking by the Potomac.
directions=Go up Seneca Road until it ends, park in the dirt lot by the roadside
content=A must less crowded option compared to Great Falls Park. Walk for miles in the undeveloped forested hills along the Potomac.

content=A Great Falls classic. It's been expanding its menu and you can find all manner of cuisines here, but still the Brogue stays true to Irish roots and its atmosphere as a crowded, noisy pub. There's also a homey dining room in the annex.
address=332 Springvale Rd, Great Falls, VA 22066
content=A high-end French restaurant. Dress code.

Visit the Old Brogue for a frosty pint of Guinness.
An average of 7 drownings per year occur in Great Falls Park, most of them alcohol-related. Consumption of alcoholic beverages is illegal within the park.
